alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wayne County through 500 PM CDT... At 415 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Clara, or 13 miles northeast of Richton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro and Clara. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Mississippi. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama.
